Name: Grimaldi's Pizzeria
Comment: also coal fired. A descendant of Lombardi's pizzeria.

Name: Patsy's Pizzeria
Comment: an OG joint in East Harlem. prolly the 4 pizzeria in NY

Name: L&B Spumoni Gardens
Comment: since 1939, the real deal ice cream of Italy... and a pizzeria with classic Sicilian squares

Name: Prince St. Pizza
Comment: NOLITA!!! neighborhood slice joint. reimagining of an old Ray's pizzeria in the 2000s. the Sicilian slice. mmmhmmm.   Gotta get the Squares!  Get the corner piece. Spicy Spring Pepperoni. A top priority. Nolita is just north of Old lil Italy

Name: Mario's Restaurant
Comment: Old style classic.  Pizza is ordered Off-Menu! Margherita is classic.

Name: Cosenza's Fish Market
Comment: the sidewalk clams!

Name: Teitel Brothers Market
Comment: old style Italian market. Sausages and meats hanging! Fresh cheeses.

Name: Luigi's Pizza
Comment: long family owned joint. still cracking out the slices!

Name: Joe's Pizza
Comment: quintessential NY slice. Just lean on an elbow, fold and enjoy!

Name: Roberta's Pizza & Bakery
Comment: Neapolitan neighborhood joint

Name: John's of Bleecker St.
Comment: John's was third pizzeria. John's is prolly the best, so says the Pizza Show

Name: Totonno's Pizzeria
Comment: Second pizzeria in NY. He was the head chef at Lombardi's. coal fired  cozy family owned joint in Coney

Name: Lombardi's Pizza
Comment: first licensed pizzeria in NY. Coal Fired since 1905! Spring Street has some good joints!  the coal OG. near Nolita's too!

Name: Ferrara Bakery & Cafe
Comment: gotta get some pastries. Cannolis

Name: Di Fara Pizza
Comment: OG!  this man started it all, and inspired everyone.  Awesome corner joint!!

Name: Esposito Meat Market
Comment: meat!  game meat! made in house sausages

Name: Dani's House of Pizza
Comment: Action Bronson's first joint

Name: Prince Coffee House
Comment: italian espresso's son!

Name: Arthur Avenue Retail Market
Comment: inside is a world of Italian meats, baked goods, etc.

Name: Alfie's Pizza
Comment: Action Bronson's second joint

Name: Bronx Little Italy
Comment: "Start at prince coffee house on Arthur Avenue with a fantastic coffee and great people watching.  We heard Italian at every table.  Then go up Arthur Avenue to the indoor Arthur Avenue retail market which is amazing.  Everything from cigars to every food you can imagine.  Keep going and shops, bakeries and restaurants abound.  End up at a wonderful bakery called Artuso bakery.  Go hungry!"

Name: Best Pizza
Comment: Pizza from the Vice Pizza Show

Name: Lucali
Comment: Place with the fun loving neighborhood focused chef!
